meta_context: Framework to build frameworks - recursive requirement

project_context.project_vision: Empower non-technical users to create professional-grade code specifications through conversational AI-guided interviews
project_context.target_audience: Product managers, entrepreneurs, business analysts without coding knowledge
project_context.core_challenge: How to transform vague ideas into structured, actionable specifications that developers can use
project_context.inspiration: Claude Skills (structured prompts) but more dynamic, refactorable, and domain-agnostic
project_context.meta_advantage: Dogfooding - built using our own planning framework, proving the concept

primary_problems.description: Non-technical users lack vocabulary to express technical requirements
primary_problems.evidence: 76% of developers use AI tools, but non-coders can't prompt effectively
primary_problems.impact: Ideas die because founders can't communicate them to developers

primary_problems.description: Gap between no-code platforms (build apps) and code generation (requires specs)
primary_problems.evidence: Bubble/Backendless build apps, Copilot/Bolt require technical specs as input
primary_problems.impact: Missing 'specification layer' - tools jump straight from idea to code

primary_problems.description: Static PRDs don't capture iterative refinement of ideas
primary_problems.evidence: Traditional specs are documents, not dynamic/refactorable artifacts
primary_problems.impact: Specs become outdated, hard to modify, don't reflect evolving understanding

primary_problems.description: VIBE Agency clients struggle to articulate project requirements
primary_problems.evidence: Internal pain point - hours spent in discovery calls extracting requirements

user_stories.i_want: Conversational interview that guides me through specification creation
user_stories.so_that: I can create professional specs without needing technical vocabulary
acceptance_criteria: Framework asks clarifying questions about my idea
I can answer in plain language (no technical jargon required)
Output is structured specification ready for developers
I can refine/edit the spec iteratively

user_stories.as_a: Entrepreneur with app idea but no technical co-founder
user_stories.i_want: Template-based starting points for common app types (web, mobile, API)
user_stories.so_that: I don't start from blank canvas, but customize proven patterns
acceptance_criteria: Library of templates (e.g., 'E-commerce web app', 'Social mobile app')
Customizable based on my unique requirements
Export to formats developers use (markdown, JSON, Jira, etc.)

user_stories.as_a: Business Analyst translating business needs to technical specs
user_stories.i_want: Framework that captures both business context and technical requirements
user_stories.so_that: Developers understand not just WHAT to build but WHY
acceptance_criteria: Spec includes business goals, user needs, technical constraints
Links between business outcomes and technical features
Traceability (feature X solves problem Y for user Z)

user_stories.i_want: Specs that answer my questions (edge cases, NFRs, constraints)
user_stories.so_that: I can start coding without 10 follow-up clarification meetings
acceptance_criteria: Spec covers functional AND non-functional requirements
Acceptance criteria defined for each feature

user_stories.i_want: Framework I can use with clients during discovery calls
user_stories.so_that: We systematically capture requirements instead of ad-hoc notes
acceptance_criteria: Can run framework live in client meeting
Captures decisions and rationale in real-time
Exports professional deliverable at end of meeting

in_scope_mvp: Template library for common patterns (5-10 starter templates)
Integration with AI code tools (export format compatible with Bolt, Cursor, etc.)
out_of_scope_mvp: Code generation (framework creates SPECS, not code)
Project management features (Jira integration future phase)
Custom template builder (use pre-built templates only)
future_phases: Phase 4: Integration marketplace (Jira, Linear, GitHub Issues)

technical: Must be 'dynamic and refactorable' (user requirement - specs are editable)
Must work for non-technical users (no coding knowledge assumed)
Must be 'robust' (user requirement - reliable, handles edge cases)
Must differentiate from Claude Skills (more flexible, not just LLM tasks)
organizational: Dogfooding requirement - use framework to improve itself
VIBE Agency integration - must fit into existing ecosystem
Client-facing - must be professional, not prototype-quality
business: Must validate market need (RA-001: Do users want spec tools?)
Must prove developer acceptance (RA-002: Are specs usable?)

key_differentiators.vs_no_code_platforms: Creates specifications, not apps - upstream of no-code tools
key_differentiators.vs_ai_code_generators: Focuses on WHAT to build (spec) vs HOW to build it (code)
key_differentiators.vs_traditional_prd_tools: Conversational and dynamic vs. static documents

success_criteria_mvp: Non-technical user can create usable spec in < 30 minutes
Developers rate spec quality 7/10 or higher
Spec completeness: Covers functional reqs, NFRs, constraints, acceptance criteria
Iterative refinement works: User can edit/improve spec without starting over

technical: How similar to Claude Skills? (architecture, format, UX?)
CLI-based or web UI or both?
product: How many templates needed for MVP?
What specification format(s) do developers prefer?
Integration priority: Which AI code tools first?
